e4: Maintaining the current policy is ethically questionable, even if it's currently accepted by sophisticated investors.  Switching to the new policy promotes transparency and long-term trust, which benefits the company more than short-term stock price manipulation.  While there might be a temporary negative market reaction, addressing the ethical concerns is paramount.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, unbiased, and consistent.  It provides a fair and accurate representation of the company's financial performance without manipulative practices.  It also considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, not just shareholders, and is compliant with all relevant accounting standards and regulations.  The clarity and understandability of the reporting are also important factors.
e6: I would ask the management team to quantify the potential short-term market impact of changing policies.  I'd also want a detailed plan to communicate the policy change to investors, addressing potential investor misunderstandings and mitigating negative reactions.  Finally, I would request a review of how the previous policy was determined and why it was implemented.
